policies.title: Engine Policies
policies.description: Built-in follow-ups and alerts. Adjust values, then click Save Policies.
policies.unreadFollowupHelp: Remind a member when unread messages sit too long.
policies.digestMinGapHelp: Minimum gap between digests for the same member.
policies.maxRepeatsHelp: Maximum follow-ups for one pending item.
policies.escalateAfterHelp: Escalate when repeat count reaches this value.
policies.keepaliveDelayHelp: Wait time after an actor says 'Next:'.
policies.actorIdleAlertHelp: Alert foreman if actor is inactive for this long.
policies.groupSilenceCheckHelp: Alert foreman if the entire group is silent.

delivery.title: Delivery
delivery.description: Control how messages and system notifications are injected into PTY runtimes.
delivery.throttleDescription: Tune pacing and read-cursor behavior. Set values to 0 to disable.
delivery.autoMarkReadHelp: Automatically advance read cursor after a message is successfully delivered to PTY.

messaging.title: Messaging
messaging.description: Configure how messages are routed when no explicit recipient is selected.
messaging.defaultRecipientDescription: Applies when <0>to</0> is empty (Web send with no recipients, IM <0>/send</0> with no <0>@targets</0>, MCP/CLI/SDK without <0>to</0>).
messaging.tip: Tip: Use explicit recipients for unambiguous routing.

imBridge.title: IM Bridge
imBridge.description: Connect this group to Telegram, Slack, Discord, Feishu/Lark, or DingTalk.
imBridge.botTokenHintSlack: Paste xoxb-… token or an env var name; required for outbound messages.
imBridge.botTokenHint: Paste the bot token or an env var name; required for bot authentication.
imBridge.appTokenHint: Optional; needed for inbound messages (Socket Mode).
imBridge.feishuRegionHint: Feishu and Lark share the same APIs but use different domains. Pick the one where your app was created.
imBridge.feishuPackageHint: Inbound streaming requires the Python package <0>lark-oapi</0> on the host running CCCC.
imBridge.appIdHint: App ID value or an env var name.
imBridge.appSecretHint: App Secret value or an env var name.
imBridge.appKeyHint: App Key value or an env var name.
imBridge.robotCodeHint: Optional; used when the session webhook is unavailable or expired.
imBridge.dingtalkPackageHint: Inbound streaming requires the Python package <0>dingtalk-stream</0> on the host running CCCC.
imBridge.setupStep1: Create a bot on your IM platform
imBridge.setupStep2: Set the token(s) as environment variable(s)
imBridge.setupStep3: Save the config and start the bridge
imBridge.setupStep4: In your IM chat, send /subscribe to receive messages

transcript.title: Terminal transcript
transcript.description: Readable tail for troubleshooting. User can always view; agent access is controlled by the policy below.
transcript.visibilityTip: Tip: This only affects agents. The Web UI user can always view transcripts.
transcript.tailViewerHint: Best-effort transcript tail from the actor PTY ring buffer.

guidance.resetHint: Delete override file and fall back to built-in

blueprint.openFromGroup: Open this tab from a group.
blueprint.exportDescription: Save this group's actors, settings, automation rules, and guidance as a single portable file.
blueprint.importDescription: Applies a blueprint by replacing actors, settings, automation rules/snippets, and group guidance overrides (CCCC_HOME). Ledger history is never modified.
blueprint.pickFileFirst: Pick a file to preview first
blueprint.replaceConfirm:
Replace this group's actors, settings, automation rules, and guidance using "{{filename}}"?

This will stop running agents and then apply group guidance overrides under CCCC_HOME:
- CCCC_PREAMBLE.md
- CCCC_HELP.md

remoteAccess.title: Remote Access (Phone)
remoteAccess.description: Configure and control remote access from here. Tailscale is the recommended first option for secure tailnet-only access.
remoteAccess.securityWarning: Treat the Web UI as high privilege (it can control agents and access project files). Do not expose it to the public internet without access control (e.g., Cloudflare Access).
remoteAccess.tokenEnforcedHint: Web token enforcement is always on in this panel (safe default).
remoteAccess.loadFailed: Failed to load remote access state.
remoteAccess.saveFailed: Failed to save remote access config.
remoteAccess.unsupported: This running daemon does not support remote access control APIs yet. Restart with a newer daemon build that includes remote_access ops.
remoteAccess.missingToken: CCCC_WEB_TOKEN is missing. Remote access start is blocked until token is configured.
remoteAccess.loopbackBinding: Web host is loopback ({{host}}). Remote devices cannot connect unless you set CCCC_WEB_HOST to a reachable address or set CCCC_WEB_PUBLIC_URL.
remoteAccess.cloudflareHint: Easiest for phone access: no VPN app required. Pair with Cloudflare Zero Trust Access for login protection.
remoteAccess.cloudflareTip: Tip: In Cloudflare Zero Trust → Access → Applications, create a "Self-hosted" app for your hostname to require login.
remoteAccess.tailscaleHint: Strong option if you're okay installing Tailscale on your phone. You can keep CCCC bound to a private interface.
remoteAccess.phoneTip: Phone tip: On iOS/Android you can "Add to Home Screen" for an app-like launcher (PWA-style).

developer.title: Developer Mode (Global)
developer.description: These settings apply to the whole CCCC instance (daemon + Web). Use this only when debugging.
developer.warningText: Developer mode enables verbose logs and extra diagnostics. Only enable it when you need it.
developer.enableHint: Enables debug snapshot and log tail tools.
developer.terminalBuffersHint: Controls how much terminal history is kept. Larger buffers use more memory (scales with running actors and opened terminals).
developer.ptyBacklogHint: Affects initial history and transcript tail. Takes full effect after restarting an actor.
developer.webScrollbackHint: Controls how far you can scroll up in the Web terminal.
developer.registryDescription: Scan missing/corrupt groups in registry. Cleanup only removes missing entries.
developer.debugSnapshotHint: Shows daemon/actors state + delivery throttle summary (developer mode only).
developer.openFromGroup: Open Settings from an active group to view group-scoped debug info.
developer.logTailHint: Tails local log files (developer mode only). Component "im" is group-scoped.
developer.imLogsRequireGroup: IM logs require a group_id; open Settings from a group.
